alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Goochland; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:57AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Cartersville affecting Goochland, Powhatan and Cumberland Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Cartersville. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Approach to old highway bridge and portions of the farm land on the left hand side of the river are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 21.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 01/10/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
